episode_title: 806 - The One With The Halloween Party

content.description: Central Perk, everyone is there as Chandler and Monica enter. Oh, and Joey is wearing a FDNY T-shirt to make this the first nod to the tragedy that Friends have made.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey you guys?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know it’s last minute, but we decided to have a Halloween party.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh good! (And there’s general excitement.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And everybody has to wear costumes. (And there’s general disconcertment.) Come on! It’ll be fun!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I’ll-I’ll be there. I mean I have to wear a costume to all my classes that day anyway so…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Please tell me you’re not gonna dress up like a dinosaur.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not two years in a row.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, I’ll come to the party but I’m not dressing up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You have to!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No way! Look, Halloween is so stupid! Dressing up, pretending to be someone you’re not…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re an actor!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So Ross, are you gonna bring Mona?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. Yeah, I think I will.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That hot girl from their wedding?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well hey-hey if she needs any idea for costumes, she could be a bikini model, or a slutty nurse, or a sexy cheerleader huh—Ooh-ooh, Leatherface from The Texas Chainsaw Massacre —No-no-no! Slutty Leatherface.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Now wasn’t Joey hitting on her at the wedding too?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right! He was hitting on her, and I got her. I guess the better man won. (To Joey) Please don’t take her from me.

content.description: A Street, Phoebe is walking down it and passes Ursula.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ursula! (Ursula turns, smiles, and continues walking.) Wait! Err-err, it’s me! Phoebe!

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Oh, I thought there was a mirror there. Okay, bye-bye. (Starts to walk again.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait a second! So, what’s new with you?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Umm, nothing. I mean, I’m getting married next week.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Yeah! Yeah, it’s gonna be a small ceremony. Just family. (Phoebe looks at her.) His.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Huh. Okay. Well, I’m really happy for you. (Starts to walk away.)

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Wait! If umm, if you want to come, I guess that’d be okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Sure! Why not? You could be my sister for the day.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Okay. Umm, y’know, my friends are having a Halloween party tonight at my old apartment so, you could come. Maybe I could meet the guy you’re marrying.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Huh. Well, I’m supposed to be working at the restaurant tonight. I’m supposed to be working right now, so who cares.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: By the way, it’s a costume party.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Oh! Okay, so that’s why you’re… (Motions to what she’s wearing.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. But thanks. (Walks away.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, The Halloween party has started. Monica is setting out some food as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait! You’re supposed to wear a costume!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I am! I am a woman who spent a lot of money on a dress and she wants to wear it, because soon she won’t be able to fit into it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ahh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m Catwoman, who wants to borrow the dress when you’re too big for it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.
(There’s a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Kids
content.text: Trick or treat!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Oh! Can I give out the candy? I really want to be with the kids right now. Y’know, ever since I got pregnant I-I have the strongest maternal instincts.

content.speaker: Kids
content.text: Trick or treat!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Just a minute!!! (She takes the candy and opens the door to two parents, a witch, a clown, and a cowgirl.) Look at you guys! Wow! You are a very scary witch. (Gives her candy.)

content.speaker: Witch
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And you are a very funny clown. (Gives him candy.)

content.speaker: Clown
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And you are so in style right now. Y’know, I work at Ralph Lauren and the whole fall line has got this like equestrian theme going on. I don’t suppose you saw the cover of British Vogue , but…

content.speaker: Cowgirl
content.text: Can I just have the candy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Sure. (Throws some in her bag and she walks away as Phoebe, dressed as Supergirl walks up and eyes Monica who eyes her back.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ah, Catwoman. So we meet again.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So we do Supergirl.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, it’s me. Phoebe!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica! Can I talk to you for a second? Listen, I appreciate you getting me the costume…
content.parenthetical: entering from the bedroom wearing a big, pink bunny costume

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, you did this to him?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! I thought he’d love it! His favorite kid’s book was the Velveteen Rabbit !

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The Velveteen Rabbit was brown and white!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, it was either a pink bunny or no bunny at all.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No bunny at all!! Always no bunny at all!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You didn’t dress up either?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes I did! I’m Chandler. (Looks at Chandler) Dude, what happened?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How is that me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. I’m Chandler (makes a growling/gurgling sound at the end and the girls laugh.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That is so you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: When have I ever done that?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: When have I ever done that?! (And does the sound again.)
(There’s a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Girl
content.text: Trick or treat!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! (Opens the door to reveal a ballerina) Well you’re just the prettiest ballerina I’ve ever seen.

content.speaker: Ballerina
content.text: Thank you. (Pirouettes.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wow! That deserves another piece of candy.

content.speaker: Ballerina
content.text: Thank you. (Does another ballerina move.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I have to say that earns tutu pieces of candy.

content.speaker: Ballerina
content.text: I love you! (Hugs Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh… Oh, honey here. Take it all. (Pours the entire large bowl into her bag and closes the door.) Monica! We need more candy?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! There’s only been like four kids.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah I know, but one of them just said that she loved me so I just gave her everything.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No wonder your pregnant.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! (He’s wearing a costume as well.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you supposed to be?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Remember the Russian satellite, Sputnik? (They all look at him.) Well, I’m a potato or a…spud. And these are my antennae. (Points to the colander with an old TV antenna glued on top that he’s wearing.) So Sputnik, becomes… (They’re still confused) Spud-nik. Spudnik!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow! I don’t have the worst costume anymore!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey all right, Ross came as doody.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I-I’m not doody.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, space doody!

(Joey gives him the okay symbol, and Ross rushes towards him to be stopped by Chandler. Meanwhile, Phoebe goes over to the snack table as some guy, which turns out to be Ursula’s fianc�e Eric, walks in and smacks her butt.)

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Aren’t you gonna give me a kiss?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I will. But right after you tell me who the hell you are.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Ursula?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ursula’s fianc�e?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Oh my God, you’re the sister!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Okay, I just slapped my future sister-in-law’s ass.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: I’m an idiot. Uh, is your mother here? Maybe I can give her a little slap on the butt.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My mother killed herself.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: She, now I knew that and…now I’m sweating. Look at me, I’m really sweating—Now I’m saying, “Look at me,” I’m getting even sweatier. I think I probably should go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no! That’s okay, we’ll just start over. Okay? Hi! I’m Phoebe.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Eric. (They shake hands and he’s squinting. And, no, it’s not me.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why are you looking at me like that?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: ‘Cause the sweat’s getting in my eyes and its burning.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (Hands him a napkin.) So, what are you?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: I don’t think they have a name for it. It’s just I get nervous; I start sweating like crazy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No I-I meant your costume.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Oh umm, I’m the solar system. (He’s wearing a black sweater with the planets glued on around the sun.) Yeah, my students helped me make it—I teach the second grade.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I love the second grade!

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! It’s so much better than first grade when you don’t know what’s going on and definitely better than third grade. Y’know with all the politics and mind games.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: So what do you do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, I’m a masseuse…by day. (Stands with her hands on her hips like a Supergirl pose.)

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Y’know you don’t have to stand here with me, believe me…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No I’m having fun. I’m really—And I’m really-really excited for you and Ursula.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Oh I feel very lucky, she’s great. I think she’s the most beautiful woman I’ve ever seen.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you.
[Time lapse, Monica is going over to talk to Joey.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Joey?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You read comic books right?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Exclusively.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who do you think would win in a fight, Catwoman or Supergirl?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Catwoman, hands down.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But between you and Phoebe, I’d have to give the edge to Phoebe.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! Really?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you kiddin’? Phoebe lived on the street. Okay? Plus, she’s got this crazy temper. She—She’s not standing right behind me is she?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No you’re fine. (Joey checks anyway.) All right well, do you think I could take Rachel?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m not sure.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! Come on I am tough! Punch me right here! (Her stomach) As hard as you can!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Will you relax?! What are you taking this so seriously for? It doesn’t matter.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh really? Okay? Well what would you say if I told you that, y’know, Ross or Chandler could beat you up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I would say, “Woman, please!”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey. Ursula’s fianc�e is really sweet! He’s a teacher, he does all this volunteer work. Y’know normally y’know, I don’t like really sweaty guys. But this one? I could just mop him up!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re getting a crush on your sister’s fianc�e.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No I’m not! You are!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Here comes the temper.
(There’s a knock on the door and Rachel opens it to a little girl.)

content.speaker: Girl
content.text: Trick or treat!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Y’know what honey, we’re actually out of candy right now. But someone just went out to get some and I have been giving out money but I’m out of that too. Hey, can I write you a check?

content.speaker: Girl
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, what’s your name?

content.speaker: Girl
content.text: Lelani Mayolanofavich.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, I’m just gonna write this out to cash.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Mona!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh! Hi!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey’s gonna be thrilled! He was hoping you’d come by as a slutty nurse.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Umm, actually I’m just a nurse.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’d think that would embarrass me, but you see I’m maxed out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You made it!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Wait-wait! You’re umm, you’re a potato…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I’m a spud…

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: And the antennae…Oh my God you’re Spudnik!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Marry her.
[Cut to Joey and Monica.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, here’s a good one for ya. Who do think would win in a fight between Ross and Chandler.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t answer that! Chandler’s my husband.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So Ross?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.
[Cut to Phoebe and Eric.]

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Hey beautiful.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hello handsome. (Sees Ursula over her shoulder) Oh God. (Walks away in shame as they kiss.) Oh look at you two. So when did you guys meet?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Two weeks ago.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Two weeks? That’s it?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Yeah, I know it sounds crazy, and it’s not like me to do something so impulsive, but she’s just so perfect, and we have so much in common.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh really?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: We’re both teachers.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Huh? (Ursula motions for Phoebe to keep quiet.)

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: And we were both in the Peace Corps.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Peace Corps, really? (Ursula motions, “I don’t know.”)

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: In fact when we were building houses in Uruguay, we were, we were just two towns apart and we never met.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Yeah. It wasn’t a town when I got there, but it was a town when I left. (To Eric) Shall we get me really drunk?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Sure.
(They walk away.)
[Cut to Mona and Ross walking past Chandler.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Howdy doody.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s funny. Yeah. Y’know you’re the funniest man here in a pink bunny costume his wife made him wear.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh relax man, relax. You’re looking a little flushed.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey-hey, I think we might find out the answer to our question.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What question?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Monica and I were talking about who could kick whose ass in a fight, you or Ross?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There’s no question.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So you think Ross too?
(Monica turns around slowly.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You picked Ross?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross is really strong! Okay, he’s the strongest out of all three of you! (Joey looks at her.) Except for Joey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I cannot believe you didn’t pick me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, in her defense, she’s right. I am stronger. I would destroy you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh really?! You think you’re stronger? Why don’t you prove it? (He pushes Ross who starts to fall backwards until Mona catches him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh I’ll prove it! I’ll prove it like a theorem!!
(They start to fight with Ross pulling on Chandler’s ears and Chandler hitting Ross over the head with his carrot.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait-wait!! Okay, stop it! Stop it! Stop! (Breaks it up.) Now listen, no one’s gonna fight in this apartment.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Monica! (Grabs her and pulls her into the living room.) People came to see a fight, let’s give ‘em what they came for!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Hey, you guys could arm wrestle.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Listen to the slutty nurse.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re going down.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah? You’re going further down! Downtown!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Seriously guys, the trash talk is embarrassing.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, the party continues with Rachel leaning on the counter as Gunther walks in carrying candy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Gunther! You brought candy! Thank you so much for picking this up! You are so sweet.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, someday you are gonna make some man the luckiest guy in the world.
(There’s a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Kid
content.text: Trick or treat!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Gotta go! (Opens the door to a boy in a cape.) Hi! Wow! There you go! (Hands him some candy.)

content.speaker: Boy in the Cape
content.text: My friend Lewis told me you were giving out money.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, we were but umm, now we’ve got candy.

content.speaker: Boy in the Cape
content.text: I’d rather have the money.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, that-that’s not your choice. Happy Halloween!

content.speaker: Boy in the Cape
content.text: This isn’t fair.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well is it fair that all you did was put on a cape and I gotta give you free stuff?

content.speaker: Boy in the Cape
content.text: Shut up!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You shut up!
(The gang gets interested now.)

content.speaker: Boy in the Cape
content.text: You can’t tell me to shut up!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, I think I just did. And uh-oh, here it comes again. Shut up!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rach?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah I know—I’m good—I got it! (Joey slowly backs away.) (To the boy) Now wait a minute, I’ve got one more thing I have to say to you…oh right! Shut up!

content.speaker: Boy in the Cape
content.text: You’re a mean old woman. (Runs away.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Wait no! Shut up—I mean don’t cry! Let me get my checkbook! (Grabs her checkbook and runs after him.)
[Cut to Mona and Joey clearing the dining room table for the grudge match between Chandler and Ross.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look honey, you don’t have to do this, okay? It’s the strength you have inside that means the most to me. You’re loyal, you’re honest, and you have integrity! That’s the kind of strength that I want in the man that I love!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That means nothing to me. (To Ross) Come on!

content.description: The Hallway, Phoebe is exiting Monica and Chandler’s, and finds Ursula standing in the hallway smoking.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi liar!

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know the only reason he’s marrying you is because he thinks all the things you were saying about yourself were true.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Well they could be true.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But they’re not!

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Yeah, it’s a fine line huh?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why are you lying to him?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: I don’t know. He said he did all this stuff and then I said I did it too and he got so excited, it was really fun.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Honey?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: It’s a filthy, disgusting habit and I want you to quit now!
content.parenthetical: waving the cigarette in Phoebe’s face

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: She’s helped so many people to quit smoking.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Y’know, we’d really better get going.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Oh right, you’ve got a church group meeting tonight.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Right. (Walks down the stairs.)

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Well, it was nice meeting you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You too. And Ursula?! It was really nice meeting you tonight!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs come on! Bunny vs. Doody! We’re waiting! (They go inside.) (To Chandler and Ross.) Okay. Okay guys, one match, winner take all. (They grasp each other’s hand in preparation for battle.) Oh wait-wait! What does the winner get?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pride.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And dignity.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, if you say so. All right, ready? Set! Go!
(They start wrestling, only they are unable to move either one’s arm despite a huge strain on their faces and a cheering crowd.)
[Time Lapse: the crowd has left and only Mona, Monica, Joey, and Phoebe are still watching to see who will be able to move the other’s arm first. An event that has yet to happen.]

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Wow! They’re both really strong.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Or equally weak.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hmm?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler’s making his sex face.
(Basically Chandler’s face looks like he’s not all there and is staring off into the distance…)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, you gettin’ tired?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nope! I can do this all day.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah? Me too. (Pause) Gettin’ a little tired though.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: God, I’m exhausted.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look this is starting to look really bad for me. Okay? Mona, Mona’s standing right over there. (Looks behind him.) Oh God, she’s talking to Joey! You gotta let me win!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No way! If anything you’ve gotta let me win! My wife thinks I’m a wimp!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, at least you have a wife! I-I keep getting divorces and knockin’ people up! And I’m dressed as doody.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re Spudnik.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, who are we kidding? I’m doody. Please? She’s watchin’.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fine. (He lets Ross win.) Oh no!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Yay! My hero!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re a weird lady.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Hey. Ursula said she left her purse.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: What a relief. It has all the numbers of the people in her prayer chain.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure it does. Yeah, yeah.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Well, I guess I’ll see you at the wedding. (Exits and Phoebe follows him into the hall.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm listen, I don’t think…I don’t think I’m gonna make it to the wedding. So I just want to wish you all the luck in the world.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: I think we’ll be okay. Besides it’s so perfect and (whispering) she’s been saving herself for me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay I can’t let you do this! She’s lying to you.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She is lying! And I bet I can prove it. Excuse me. (She grabs Ursula’s purse and starts going through it and finds some papers.) Okay. Okay. Yeah—Not a prayer chain, but what looks like a detailed drawing of a bank floor plan. (Holds up her nametag.) Okay, here’s the nametag from the restaurant where she works as a waitress! Not a teacher, a waitress. All right, here’s her driver license, this oughta be good, she always lies about this. How old did she say she was?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: She told me she was 25.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I almost don’t want to show this. (Hands it to him.) Just remember I’m a minute younger.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: I am so stupid. Of course she was lying! She’s not a teacher. There’s not such a thing as the top secret elementary school for the children of spies.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. You’re not, you’re not stupid.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: I’m not smart. (Phoebe has no comeback.) I just wanted so much to…be impulsive once. To be romantic.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s good, you should be impulsive and you should be romantic. Just…you did it with the wrong person. (He looks at her.) What?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: It’s just so weird, two people look so much alike, and so different.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Eric!! Let’s go!!

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: I’d better go, deal…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, you should. (They shake hands.)

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Hurry up I gotta pray!!
(Phoebe hands Eric Ursula’s purse and he walks away.)
[Time Lapse: Rachel is returning from chasing down the boy in the cape.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Well, I had to give the kid fifty bucks to stop crying.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s not so bad.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I also had to go to a couple houses with him as his girlfriend. Oh, I am just awful with children!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on! You’re good with kids. They’re just crazy on Halloween. Y’know, they’re all greedy and hopped up on sugar!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really? You think that’s all it is?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Absolutely! Halloween is the worst. Except for Christmas…and their birthdays. Kinda get a little crazy during the summer too. And anytime they’re hungry or sleepy. Y’know, kids are tough. Good luck with that. (Walks away.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler and Monica are standing in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, I wanted to tell I’m-I’m sorry you lost.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Listen, I’ve got a secret for ya. I let him win.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is that a secret or a lie.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I let him win—Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Would you tell her I let you win please?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. Yeah. (Sarcastically) Uh Chandler let me win. No, Chandler’s really strong. Oh my arm is so sore. Oh nurse! (Waddles over to Mona.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am strong! I’ll show you! (He sits down at the table.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler please!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh what’s the matter? Are you scared?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Let’s go big bunny!
(They assume the starting position.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. 1…2…3—Go! (Once again he’s at a stalemate, but this time he’s in pain.) (Pause) I’m gonna kill myself!
